brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate the effectiveness of the Brøset anger management
      model in reducing violent behavior amongst clients who are violent in intimate partnerships
      and who voluntarily seek help.

      Violence in intimate partnerships constitutes a serious problem worldwide and there is
      reason to believe that cognitive behavior therapy has some effect on the reduction of
      violent behavior. However, there are currently too few randomized controlled studies to
      conclude about the effectiveness of cognitive behavior therapy for this client group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  fluent in Norwegian language

          -  is in a partner relationship at inclusion. Partner relationship is defined by having
             an intimate partner at present, or being in regular contact with a former intimate
             partner so that violence is possible (e.g. they have children)

          -  admits being violent to his partner (physical, mental and/or sexual)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  psychosis

          -  alcohol- or drug addiction to a level that hinders group participation free from
             intoxication.

intervention.description: manualised structured cognitive treatment program 15 weeks (30 hours)

facility.name: St Olavs University Hospital, Division of Psychiatry, Centre for research and education in forensic psychiatry Brøset

clinical_study.official_title: Partner Violence and Anger Management: a Randomised Controlled Study of the Effectiveness of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy

overall_official.affiliation: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

primary_outcome.description: measured by using the Conflict Tactics Scale Revised (CTS2), instrument for measuring violence in intimate partnerships(10), which consists of 78 questions (0-7) about different aspects of violence (frequence of physical, psychological, sexual and material violence)
primary_outcome.measure: violent behaviour, reported by partner and client

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: measured by using the Hopkins Symptoms Check List (HSCL-25, with 25 questions about the presence and intensity of anxiety and depression symptoms, and symptoms of somatoform character)
secondary_outcome.measure: The client's and their partner's mental health
The client's and their partner's health service use and absence due to sickness

secondary_outcome.description: Emotional regulation will be assessed by the Difficulties in Emotion Regulation Scale (DERS, Gratz & Roemer, 2004).

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
